result.execSummary:
The defendant Tian N Clouse was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Issue of Worthless Checks(<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(1).
  • Issue of Worthless Checks(<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.24(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Jefferson County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
On Count #5  the Court withholds sentence, and places Ms. Clouse on Probation for two years.

**11/13/18: The Court extends Ms. Clouse's probation for one year. The Court orders payments of $100 per month be paid towards restitution beginning 12/1/18. Once restitution is paid in full, Ms. Clouse's probation can be terminated. All remaining obligations, including attorney fees are to be reduced to civil judgment at that time**

miscConds.notes:
--to pay restitution of $1,126.30 to Sentry in Lake Mills; the Court clarifies that this is not a Joint and Several obligation

--to pay the 10% restitution processing

--to pay costs, fees, surcharges including the DNA surcharges
-
-to reimburse $99 in subpoena fees 

***PER 2-9-17 ORDER -Order for payment of Atty. Karl Huebner as appointed defense counsel in the amount of $259 (assessed in Count # 5)***
--to maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--no contact with the Co-Defendant Tiffany Statz

--to take a criminal thinking course as directed by the Agent 

--to undergo any other type  of assessment and counseling as directed by the Agent

--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand

--If probation, parole or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of the victim(s) and government entities for the balance due.

ARRESTING AGENCY: Lake Mills PD
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
The Court grants the Defense request for expungement of this record upon the successful completion of the Probation term.

DA Happ gives position of probation extension/payment of restitution. 

The Court extends Ms. Clouse's probation for one year. The Court orders payments of $100 per month be paid towards restitution beginning 12/1/18. Once restitution is paid in full, Ms. Clouse's probation can be terminated. All remaining obligations, including attorney fees are to be reduced to civil judgment at that time

records.addlTxt: Order for payment of Atty. Karl Huebner as appointed defense counsel in the amount of $259.  cc: Defendant, DA (electronically), Atty Huebner, DOC   /tn 2-16-17

It is hereby ordered that: The Defendant is liable for court appointed attorney fees.  Attorney fees shall be paid as a condition of probation.  The Judgment of Conviction shall be amended to reflect said order. An amended assessment report shall be provided to Probation & Parole.

to Disburse Restitution in the amount of $ 450.00

with Elements
Criminal Case Settlement

[MK] case called at 9:30am. 
Defendant Tian N Clouse in court with Attorney Karl E Huebner.  ADA Jeffrey M Shock appears for the State of Wisconsin.  
Constitutional rights reviewed; pleas of " No Contest " entered on Counts #5 and #6; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the pleas, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Count # 7.

On Counts #5 and #6, the Court withholds sentence, and places Ms. Clouse on Probation for two years, with conditions:
--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment
--to take a criminal thinking course as directed by the Agent 
--to undergo any other type  of assessment and counseling as directed by the Agent
--no contact with the Co-Defendant Tiffany Statz 
--to maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--to pay restitution of $1,126.30 to Sentry in Lake Mills; the Court clarifies that this is not a Joint and Several obligation
--to pay the 10% restitution processing 
--to comply with DNA sample provision upon demand
--to pay costs, fees, surcharges including the DNA surcharges
--to reimburse $99 in subpoena fees 

Days credit for time already served: 5 days
The Court grants the Defense request for expungement of this record upon the successful completion of the Probation term. 
recess 9:40am
In response to Clerk's Note: Please modify bail amount to $450 cc: attorneys

Bond Payment Information

Jury trial on December 19 or 20, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Final status/scheduling conference on December 6, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Case called at 1:31 pm [sf] Commissioner Weber presiding for Br. 2
Defendant Tian N Clouse in custody, via video from the Jefferson County Jail . Public Service Special Prosecutor Melanie Susan Flint appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Prior to the Hearing Attorney Svehlek advises that Attorney Huebner has been Court Appointed on this case and that SPD will not be appearing with her today. Attorney Svehlek also advises that Attorney Huebner is aware of todays hearing but is not at the jail.
Upon stipulation, the Court finds the video connection to be sight and sound sufficient. 
Court reviews procedural posture of the case.
Bail/Bond recommendations presented by counsel.

Court requires an additional $350 CASH bond, with previous non-monetary conditions: 
-No contact with Tiffany Statz
-No presence at Sentry in Lake Mills

Recess: 1:37 pm
NEXT: (1) Final Status / Scheduling Conference scheduled for 12/6/16 at 9:00 am  - send notices (2) Jury Trial scheduled for 12/19/16 or 12/20/16 at 8:30 am - send notices (3) Pretrial Conference scheduled for 11/2/16 at 9:40 am - send notices

Case called at 3:10 pm [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for STC)
[Reserve Judge Neal Nettesheim presiding for BrIV]
Attorney Karl E Huebner in court. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Tian N Clouse not in court. 
Atty Huebner informs the Court that he has spoken with Miss Clouse, she was unable to obtain transportation for today's hearing, requests matter be rescheduled.
ADA Beck requests warrant, presents basis including multiple previous non-appearances and previous warrant
Court orders issuance of bench warrant - Body only and forfeits bond
Recess: 3:13 pm
Status conference on June 13, 2016 at 02:30 pm.

Case called at 3:19 pm [Clerk SH] (Case was scheduled for STC)
Attorney Karl E Huebner in court. Defendant Tian N Clouse not in court. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Atty Huebner informs the Court that he is unsure why Miss Clouse does not appear. Was going to request a DA PTC as do not yet have an offer in this case. 
ADA Shock does not oppose an issuance and stay of warrant
Court orders issuance of bench warrant and STAYS issuance of warrant until next court date of 6/13/16 at 2:30 pm 
Recess: 3:22 pm 

NEXT: Reschedule STC 6/13/16 at 2:30 pm - Send notices
Status conference on May 27, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
